str2: Of Hebrew origin; Jesus, the name of our Lord and two other Israelites.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Passive - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: From apo and krino; to conclude for oneself, i.e. to respond; by Hebraism to begin to speak.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From nomos; according to law, i.e. Legal; as noun, an expert in the law.
Of Hebrew origin; a separatist, i.e. Exclusively religious; a Pharisean, i.e. Jewish sectary.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular

str2: From the same as therapon; to wait upon menially, i.e. to adore, or to relieve.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Or, than. A primary particle of distinction between two connected terms; disjunctive, or; comparative, than.
No, not. Also ouk, and ouch a primary word; the absolute negative adverb; no or not.
